verb.description: Survey goods for sale in a leisurely and casual way.
examples: he stopped to browse around a sporting goods store

verb.description: (of an animal) feed on leaves, twigs, or other high-growing vegetation.
examples: they reach upward to browse on bushes
the animals browse the high foliage of trees

noun.description: An act of casual looking or reading.
examples: the brochure is well worth a browse

noun.description: Vegetation, such as twigs and young shoots, eaten by animals.
examples: a moose needs to eat forty to fifty pounds of browse a day

origin: Late Middle English (in browse (sense 2 of the verb)): from Old French broster, from brost young shoot, probably of Germanic origin.
